intro: Marginaria squamata, commonly known as the squamate marginaria, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Marginaria squamata is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
